content:
TITLE: Connecting to Azure DevOps and Listing Projects
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to establish a connection to Azure DevOps using personal access token authentication and retrieve a list of projects. The code shows pagination handling for large project lists and uses the core client for basic operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from azure.devops.connection import Connection
from msrest.authentication import BasicAuthentication
import pprint

# Fill in with your personal access token and org URL
personal_access_token = 'YOURPAT'
organization_url = 'https://dev.azure.com/YOURORG'

# Create a connection to the org
credentials = BasicAuthentication('', personal_access_token)
connection = Connection(base_url=organization_url, creds=credentials)

# Get a client (the "core" client provides access to projects, teams, etc)
core_client = connection.clients.get_core_client()

# Get the first page of projects
get_projects_response = core_client.get_projects()
index = 0
while get_projects_response is not None:
    for project in get_projects_response.value:
        pprint.pprint("[" + str(index) + "] " + project.name)
        index += 1
    if get_projects_response.continuation_token is not None and get_projects_response.continuation_token != "":
        # Get the next page of projects
        get_projects_response = core_client.get_projects(continuation_token=get_projects_response.continuation_token)
    else:
        # All projects have been retrieved
        get_projects_response = None
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Azure DevOps Python Package
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the azure-devops package using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install azure-devops
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Compiling Python Code Macro
DESCRIPTION: A macro named 'b' that compiles all Python files in the current directory and forces recompilation with the -f flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/scripts/windows/macros.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
b=python -m compileall . -f
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Search Macros using Findstr
DESCRIPTION: A collection of findstr macros to search for text patterns in various file types with different filter options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/scripts/windows/macros.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
f=findstr /ips /c:"$*" *
fm=findstr /mips /c:"$*" *
fcs=findstr /ips /c:"$*" *.cs
fjs=findstr /ips /c:"$*" *.js
fts=findstr /ips /c:"$*" *.ts
fproj=findstr /ips /c:"$*" *.*proj
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Directory Navigation Macros
DESCRIPTION: A set of macros for quickly navigating up directory levels, opening files in Notepad, and opening directories in Explorer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/scripts/windows/macros.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
up=cd ..
up1=cd ..
up2=cd ..\..
up3=cd ..\..\...
up4=cd ..\..\..\...
up5=cd ..\..\..\..\...
up6=cd ..\..\..\..\..\...
up7=cd ..\..\..\..\..\..\...
n=notepad.exe $*
e=explorer $*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Navigation Macro for PowerShell Environment
DESCRIPTION: A PowerShell macro that changes the current directory to the build directory using environment variables. This navigation aid helps developers quickly access the build directory in their development environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/scripts/windows/macros.ps.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: PowerShell
CODE:
```
src=pushd $env:BUILDDIR
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Navigation Macro for cmd.exe
DESCRIPTION: Defines a 'src' macro to change the current directory to the build directory using the pushd command. This allows quick navigation to the build directory in cmd.exe sessions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-devops-python-api/blob/dev/scripts/windows/macros.cmd.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Batch
CODE:
```
src=pushd %BUILDDIR%
```
